title: Death Toll Rises as Russia Bombards Ukraine’s Cities for a Fourth Day
description: Prompted by the expanded strikes, European countries made plans to develop joint air defenses and to train Ukrainian soldiers on European Union soil.

title: As Immigration Issue Looms, Biden Officials Turn Eye to Latin America
description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken, just back from South America, met again with his Mexican counterpart.

title: Inquiry on Trudeau Using Emergency Powers on Trucker Protests Begins
description: Lawyers for the Canadian government and opponents clashed on whether the government had been justified in using the powers during protests that paralyzed Ottawa last February.

title: At a children’s hospital in Kyiv, young patients seek shelter after days of strikes.
Your Friday Briefing: U.S. Inflation Keeps Soaring
description: Plus Europe’s search for energy and U.S. attempts to hinder China’s technological development.

title: North Korea Tests a Missile and Flies Warplanes Near Border With South
description: South Korea dispatched its own warplanes in a show of force as the North appeared intent on keeping tensions high on the Korean Peninsula.

title: Russia Says It Will Evacuate Civilians From Kherson Amid Ukrainian Gains
description: The announcement seemed timed to deflect attention from Russian forces who, since Monday, have killed more than three dozen Ukrainians in a barrage of missile strikes on towns and cities.

title: Amid Turmoil, Can Truss Afford to Hold on to Tax-Cutting Plan?
description: Prime Minister Liz Truss and her chancellor of the Exchequer, Kwasi Kwarteng, say they are holding steady on their plans, but experts believe concessions are inevitable.

title: Putin Offers to Make Turkey a Gas Hub to Preserve EU Energy Hold
description: Energy experts have questioned the viability of the Russian president’s proposal, saying it seemed unlikely that the bloc would approve new pipelines for Russian gas to Europe.

title: Hurricane Ian’s Financial Toll Threatens Florida’s Real Estate Market
description: The hurricane’s record-breaking cost will make it even harder for many to get insurance, experts say — threatening home sales, mortgages and construction.

title: How Two Teenagers Became the New Faces of Iran’s Protests
description: The 16-year-old girls were killed by the Iranian security services in a crackdown on the protests that have rocked the country for the past month.

title: No New Trial in Murder Mystery That Gripped France, Court Rules
description: Omar Raddad was convicted in the 1991 killing of a wealthy widow, but scant evidence and a grammatical error sowed doubts about his guilt. He sought a retrial based on new DNA evidence.

title: Iraqi Parliament Elects Abdul Latif Rashid as New President
description: The vote is the first step to forming a new government after a year of political deadlock and heightened instability.

title: Saudi Arabia Pushes Back at U.S. Outrage Over Oil Cuts
description: The kingdom said it had rejected the Biden administration’s urging for a one-month delay to the reduction in output. That could have prevented a price spike before the American midterm elections.

title: What Happened to Monkeypox?
description: Why cases suddenly began to decline.

title: Kyiv Region of Ukraine Hit by Suspected ‘Kamikaze’ Drones
description: The weapons are causing havoc in a region that had been largely spared since the early months of the war.

title: Ukraine Says It Will Take Weeks to Fully Restore Power After Attacks
description: It’s the first time since the start of the war that Russian forces have targeted the energy infrastructure so broadly.

title: Inside the Global Effort to Keep Perfectly Good Food Out of the Dump
description: Around the world, lawmakers and entrepreneurs are taking steps to tackle two of humanity’s most pressing problems: hunger and climate change.

title: Bob Dylan’s “The Philosophy of Modern Song”: An Excerpt
description: In his first collection of writing since “Chronicles: Volume One,” Dylan takes on the songs that captivate and define us. Here are two excerpts from his new book.

title: With Leaps and Bounds, Parkour Athletes Turn Off the Lights in Paris
description: As an energy crisis looms, nimble young activists are using superhero-like moves to switch off wasteful lights that stores leave on all night.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Western support for Ukraine.

title: Germany Needs Coal to Replace Gas, So a Village Has to Go
description: The cutting of Russian gas supplies to Europe has led Germany to step up coal use, despite its goal to phase it out by 2030.
